dt: {bc}the whole body of salt water that covers nearly three fourths of the surface of the earth

dt.t: The {wi}ocean{/wi} covers most of our planet, regulates our weather and climate, absorbs vast amounts of carbon dioxide, provides most of our oxygen, and feeds much of the human population.

dt: {bc}any of the large bodies of water into which the great ocean is divided
{bc}a very large or unlimited quantity or expanse

dt.t: He would have {wi}oceans{/wi} of time for his ride.
Jutting from an {wi}ocean{/wi} of prairie, they [the Sangre de Cristo mountains] run north-south like an iguana spine …

et: Middle English {it}occean{/it} "the sea flowing around the land mass of the known world," borrowed from Anglo-French, borrowed from Latin {it}Ōceanus,{/it} borrowed from Greek {it}Ōkeanós,{/it} probably of pre-Greek substratal origin

Preserved variants of Greek {it}Ōkeanós,{/it} as {it}Ōgḗn, Ōgenós, Ōgēnós,{/it} may indicate that the velar stop, whatever its original voicing, was palatalized (hence {it}*ūkʸān-{/it}?)—strongly suggesting non-Indo-European origin. Old attempts to find an Indo-European origin (as a comparison with Sanskrit {it}ā-śayāna-{/it} "lying on") are unconvincing.
shortdef: the whole body of salt water that covers nearly three fourths of the surface of the earth
any of the large bodies of water into which the great ocean is divided
a very large or unlimited quantity or expanse

dt: {bc}any of several marine scorpaenid food fishes (genus {it}Sebastes{/it}):
{bc}one ({it}S. alutus{/it}) abundant in the northeastern Pacific from Japan to the Bering Sea to southern California

shortdef: any of several marine scorpaenid food fishes (genus Sebastes):
redfish; also : a related food fish (S. fasciatus)
one (S. alutus) abundant in the northeastern Pacific from Japan to the Bering Sea to southern California

dt: {bc}a large bony fish ({it}Mola mola{/it} of the family Molidae, order Tetraodontiformes) having high dorsal and anal fins and a body nearly oval in outline and attaining a length of 10 feet (3 meters) and a weight in excess of 2 tons (1.8 metric tons)

shortdef: a large bony fish (Mola mola of the family Molidae, order Tetraodontiformes) having high dorsal and anal fins and a body nearly oval in outline and attaining a length of 10 feet (3 meters) and a weight in excess of 2 tons (1.8 metric tons)

dt: resort town on a 10-mile (16-kilometer) long barrier island facing the Atlantic in southeastern Maryland {it}population{/it} 7102

shortdef: resort town on a 10-mile (16-kilometer) long barrier island facing the Atlantic in southeastern Maryland population 7102

dt: {bc}an elevated region with a central valley on an ocean floor at the boundary between two diverging tectonic plates where new crust forms from upwelling magma

shortdef: an elevated region with a central valley on an ocean floor at the boundary between two diverging tectonic plates where new crust forms from upwelling magma

dt: ocean north of the Arctic Circle

shortdef: ocean north of the Arctic Circle

dt: ocean separating North and South America from Europe and Africa {it}area{/it} 31,814,640 square miles (82,399,918 square kilometers), often divided into the

shortdef: ocean separating North and South America from Europe and Africa area 31,814,640 square miles (82,399,918 square kilometers), often divided into the North Atlantic Ocean and the South Atlantic Ocean
